str2: Immediately, soon, at once. Adverb from euthus; directly, i.e. At once or soon.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To raise, lift up, take away, remove.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A bed, mattress, mat of a poor man. Probably of foreign origin; a mattress.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
From en and pros; in front of (literally or figuratively) or time).
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
So that, therefore, so then, so as to. From hos and te; so too, i.e. Thus therefore.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
From ek and histemi; to put out of wits, i.e. Astound, or become astounded, insane.
To glorify, honor, bestow glory on. From doxa; to render glorious.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).
